block.p: Daisy Expósito-Ulla, a longtime executive at agencies specializing in the Hispanic market, is returning to advertising by buying a majority stake in an agency, CMS/Partners in New York, that was started last year by former colleagues. Financial terms were not disclosed.

Ms. Expósito-Ulla will become chairwoman at the agency, renamed D Expósito & Partners. Her former colleagues, Fernando Fernández and Gloria Constanza, who were partners at CMS/Partners, will be partners at the renamed agency. Ms. Expósito-Ulla had most recently been chairwoman and chief executive at the Bravo Group in New York, part of the Young & Rubicam Brands division of the WPP Group.

Two executives are joining D Expósito as partners: Mary C. Miqueli, another former colleague of Ms. Expósito-Ulla, and Jorge Ulla, Ms. Expósito-Ulla's husband. D Expósito will have 20 employees working for clients like General Electric and Unilever.
